### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So until about a weekish ago, Everything would work smoothly, except for some other issues that did annoy me, but I had workarounds for them. Those issues was pieces os not working after a while. Not a big deal since I would just close it in task manager and reopen it once it was all closed to force a hard restart of the whole system. But, now (thanks for listening to my little rant up there) there is an issue that I cannot workaround. For some reason pieces cannot get any context from any files or folders, and its getting pretty annoying to the fact that I have started using other softwares because at least they can look at the files and suggest changes or edits that actually have something to do with my code. I believe this happened ever since i updated pieces os about 2-3 updates ago, but cannot pinpoint any specific cause. Another cause may be that fact that I downloaded Ollama but never really used it.

* User is unable to access the contents of files despite the app recognizing the file names.

* The issue persists across different folders and files.
* User is running Windows 11 Home, 24H2.
* The specific files mentioned include 3 files with thousands of lines of code and one file with 200-300 lines of code.

**Problems identified:**

* The app is unable to read the contents of files.
* This issue specifically affects large files.
* The root cause of the issue remains unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The developer mentions potential code changes that could resolve the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* A call is scheduled with the user and the developer to further explore the problem.

There is a video here that describes the problem
## Conversation Summary: PiecesOS Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM) issue

**Key Points Raised:**

- User (@Iliya3ProX) reported an issue where the LTM engine would not enable.
- User shared a video and logs to assist in troubleshooting.
- User also reported an issue with the PyCharm plugin crashing after a reinstall.
- Another user (@AyomideA-S) reported the same LTM issue.

**Problems Identified:**

- A downloaded local LLM was overriding the saved selected model, preventing the LTM engine from activating.
- One of the dependencies for the LTM engine, Qdrant, was failing to boot on the user's machine.
- The PyCharm plugin was crashing after a reinstall.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- A patch was released to fix the issue with the downloaded LLM overriding the saved model.
- The Pieces team is updating their database infrastructure, which should resolve the Qdrant booting issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The LTM issue should be resolved with the latest update (version 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of the Desktop application).
- The Qdrant booting issue is still being investigated.
- The PyCharm plugin crash issue is being investigated.

**Additional Notes:**

- The user confirmed that the LTM engine was working after reinstalling PiecesOS from the Microsoft store.
- The user also reported high idle time expense.
- The user is using Yandex Translate to communicate, which may lead to some miscommunication.

related_issues.text:
Obsidian Plugin
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi! I'm attempting to get the Pieces for Devs Obsidian plugin to work. The installation of the Pieces for Devs " Pieces for Obsidian plugin" goes seemingly faultless as it reports in green: " Pieces for Obsidian plugin installed successfully". 

 However, as soon as I attempt to enable the plugin (v1.21.1)the following error pops up ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”. 
- Obsidian v1.7.7 is up to date, and running. 
- Pieces OS v11.0.3 is running, and 
- Pieces for Devs Desktop is up and running @ v3.3.3. 
- The OS is Windows 10 Pro 64 bit Version 22H2, Build 19045.5247 updated 02-02-2025

I have followed the guidelines in the following documentation (https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian). The install fails with a not-very-helpful answer. ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”

Referring to the section "https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian#having-trouble-with-the-pieces-for-developers-obsidian-plugin" in the documentation still fails to provide the expected results, so the next step would be to attempt to find related installation logs that might shed light on the issue.

I've searched for possible issues indicating this type of bug/issue but none were found here on GitHub.
I had a look at the `obsidian.log` file in the `C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\obsidian` folder but there's no indication at all nor any mention of any plugins or installations related to such.

Repeat uninstall/reinstall advice does not resolve the problem either.
Could you indicate which other Pieces, Obsidian and Win-OS logs would be the most appropriate to investigate which might shed light on the cause, please?

**Edit:**
I'm using other plugins without any issues.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19b3dcd2-05fa-4171-ae2e-dc71b5ce451c)

Thank you for looking into this.
## GitHub Issue Summary: 

**Key Points:**

* User Andre-ADPC is experiencing issues with the Pieces for Obsidian plugin.

**Problems Identified:**

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open, indicating that Andre may still be experiencing problems or requiring further assistance. 
* It's unclear whether Andre has responded to the latest instructions provided by bishoy-at-pieces.

related_issues.title: Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
related_issues.text:
Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Web Extension, JetBrains, VS Code, Visual Studio, Obsidian, JupyterLab, Sublime Plugin, Raycast Extension, Pieces CLI, Neovim

### Operating System / Platform

macOS/Windows/Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We introduce one of the largest releases in the Pieces Ecosystem.

Lots of bug fixes - targeting some of the largest hitches in the user journey to name a few: rate limiting(authenticate to bypass, + better error messaging), entirely new Ollama (local LLM) infrastructure w/ in the copilot, and tackling installation head-on.

The detailed list of changes is not quite ready yet; however, it will be here shortly. (I will post them here when they are)

However, this issue is here let you know to update all your plugins and provide the status of all of the new plugins(in the case they are not yet out in production)

Pieces For Developers(Desktop Application): 3.3.0 - Live
PiecesOs: 11.0.0 - Live
vscode: 2.0.0 - Live
JetBrains: 11.0.0 - Live
Visual Studio: 4.0.0 - Live
Jupyter: 1.21.0 - Live
Obsidian: 1.21.0 - Live
Sublime: 1.5.0 - Live
CLI: - 1.9.0 Live
NeoVim: - 1.3.0 Live
Chrome(web) Extension: - 4.0.0 (This is under review)

Please, if you have any questions about the release or are having trouble updating to the latest, comment in this thread, and we can help you out!!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Browser extension on Pieces OS 11.0.0 is blinking excessively.
* Pop-up notification urging users to update extensions is disruptive.
* User mistakenly uninstalled an extension due to confusing version information.
* Pop-up appears even when extensions are already updated.
* Users are concerned about pop-up persisting after disabling extensions.

**Problems Identified:**

* Blinking extension icon distracts users.
* Unnecessary pop-up prompts require repeated dismissal.
* Extension version requirement confusion leads to uninstalling working extensions.
* Pop-up triggers even when extensions are up-to-date.
* Disabling extensions doesn't remove the pop-up.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update extensions to ensure the pop-up disappears.
* Remove the pop-up in the next Pieces OS update 
* Provide more robust error message for extension version inconsistencies.
* Improve logic to avoid prompting for updates on uninstalled extensions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The pop-up issue is scheduled to be resolved in the next OS update.
* User confusion regarding extension versions is temporarily mitigated by screenshots and instructions.
* Further investigation needed on unnecessary pop-up triggers for updated extensions.


This summary emphasizes the points raised throughout the conversation, identifies the problematic behavior, outlines proposed solutions, and summarizes the progress towards resolution. Additionally, it highlights areas requiring further attention.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues in remote environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from VS Code in remote environments, particularly docker containers. This is often due to recent updates affecting port usage and network configurations. Solutions include updating to the latest Pieces OS and VS Code plugin versions, which offer automatic detection and eliminate the need for manual custom URL configurations.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Conversation Summary: ### Key points: - User malanciault is experiencing an issue where they cannot access Pieces OS from their devcontainer. - The problem seems related to a recent update to Pieces OS that requires it to be hosted on a different port. - Several workarounds are attempted, but none of them are successful. - The root cause of the problem is identified to be a network change that prevents Pieces from listening on all interfaces by default. ### Solutions proposed/implemented: - **Proposed:** Set a custom URL using host.docker.internal. - **Proposed:** Create a DNS name entry for 'pieceshost'. - **Implemented:** A patch to the VSCode plugin that allows for automatic detection of Pieces OS and eliminates the need for a custom URL. ### Current status/outcome: The issue appears to be resolved with the release of VSCode plugin version 2.0.1, which allows for automatic detection of Pieces OS and eliminates the need for a custom url. **Open questions**: * Whether the user has been able to verify the fix and whether their problem is resolved.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## GitHub Issue Summary **Key Points Raised:** * Pieces OS updates changed port usage, causing network request failures in the dev console. * This issue is not a privacy concern as only Pieces OS endpoints are checked. * Users find the errors invasive and distracting during debugging. **Problems Identified:** * Network request failures flood the dev console with unnecessary errors. * Debugging is hampered by mixing phantom errors with real errors. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * A fix was planned for the upcoming patch update for the extension. * Due to a potential Chrome bug, the fix was not implemented. * Users can hide network messages in the dev console settings to mitigate the issue. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue remains unresolved and requires a solution from Chrome developers. * Users can work around the problem by hiding network messages in the dev console. **Additional Notes:** * The user appreciates Pieces OS and is willing to overlook the issue during trials but desires a resolution for long-term adoption.

Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation
**Key points raised:**

* Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature is in testing phase and currently only works with X11 on Linux.
* The feature is not functioning properly for some users on Wayland.
* The LTM feature activation button is not working as expected and does not provide clear error messages.

**Problems identified:**

* LTM feature doesn't work on Wayland.
* LTM activation button doesn't provide clear error messages.
* Difficulty getting LTM to work across different Linux distros.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User is advised to try switching to X11.
* Pieces team requests access to log files for troubleshooting.
* Video call is scheduled to troubleshoot live.
* Pieces team acknowledges similar issue reported in another GH thread.
* Pieces team discovers a failing dependency and is in the process of deprecating it.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation. 
* Pieces team is working on a solution and will keep users updated. 
* A live troubleshooting session is scheduled for Thursday.

common_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on various operating systems, particularly Linux. Problems include feature unavailability, activation errors, and inconsistent performance. Solutions involve switching to X11 on Linux, troubleshooting with the Pieces team, and awaiting a planned infrastructure migration.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation
**Key points raised:**

* Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature is in testing phase and currently only works with X11 on Linux.
* The feature is not functioning properly for some users on Wayland.
* The LTM feature activation button is not working as expected and does not provide clear error messages.

**Problems identified:**

* LTM feature doesn't work on Wayland.
* LTM activation button doesn't provide clear error messages.
* Difficulty getting LTM to work across different Linux distros.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User is advised to try switching to X11.
* Pieces team requests access to log files for troubleshooting.
* Video call is scheduled to troubleshoot live.
* Pieces team acknowledges similar issue reported in another GH thread.
* Pieces team discovers a failing dependency and is in the process of deprecating it.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation. 
* Pieces team is working on a solution and will keep users updated. 
* A live troubleshooting session is scheduled for Thursday.

## GitHub Issue Summary: Can't turn on Long-Term Memory Engine

**Key points:**

* User Shariq12345 reported an issue with enabling the Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine in Pieces app.
* The bot responded by acknowledging the issue and suggesting related resources for support.
* Support representative, Mark Widman, confirmed the issue and informed Shariq12345 about ongoing efforts to replace the current LTM infrastructure.
* Shariq12345 expressed appreciation for the support and acknowledged the app's UI.
* Mark Widman provided an update on the migration timeline, stating they are aiming for an end-of-month release.


**Problems identified:**

* User unable to turn on the Long-Term Memory Engine in Pieces app.
* Existing LTM infrastructure causing issues for certain users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Replacing the current LTM infrastructure with a new system.
* Targeting end-of-month release for the updated database stack.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Work in progress on migrating LTM infrastructure.
* Completion expected by the end of January 2025.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation suggests the LTM issue might be affecting multiple users.
* No immediate alternative solution was offered while the migration is in progress.
